clinical_study.brief_title: Implementing, Evaluating, and Scaling Up of the Strengthening a Palliative Approach in Long Term Care (SPA-LTC) Program
clinical_study.official_title: Implementing, Evaluating, and Scaling Up of the Strengthening a Palliative Approach in Long Term Care (SPA-LTC) Program

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the implementation of the Strengthening a Palliative Approach in Long-Term Care (SPA-LTC) program using a Stepped-Wedge Randomized Controlled Trial design.

detailed_description.textblock:
The SPA-LTC program has been developed and refined through prior participatory action based studies.
Evidence-based components of the program include:
Interdisciplinary Champion Teams; Palliative Care Education, including illness-trajectory pamphlets for staff and family members; Comfort Care Rounds with staff; Prognostic Tools to trigger end-of-life discussions; Palliative Care Conferences; Bereavement Pamphlets for families; and Post-Bereavement Follow-Up for families, and staff
The goal is to implement and assess this program across three provinces in Canada (Ontario, Saskatchewan, Manitoba). The investigators will use the findings to revise the program and inform the scaling up of the program across diverse settings and provinces.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: LTC homes are assigned randomized to 3 different time periods (steps) to implement the SPA-LTC program.
study_design_info.masking_description: With the stepped-wedge design there is no need to mask participants, clinicians or research staff.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Emergency Department Visits in the Resident's Last Year of Life
primary_outcome.time_frame: All residents in the home who died one year prior to the implementation of each step and one year prior to the date of death for all residents in the home who die during the study intervention period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Family Perceptions of End of Life Care
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Survey completed at enrolment into the study; survey completed 2 months after the Family Care Conference or 1 month after the end of the intervention period if no Family Care Conference occurred.

secondary_outcome.measure: Family Experiences with End of Life Care
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Interview completed at enrolment into the study; survey completed 2 months after the Family Care Conference or 1 month after the end of the intervention period if no Family Care Conference occurred.

secondary_outcome.measure: Staff Knowledge about a Palliative Approach to Care
secondary_outcome.time_frame: All staff in all participating long-term care homes will complete a staff survey at 4 time points in the study: during the transition period prior to each intervention step and one month following the end of the intervention in the last step (Step 3).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Hospital Transfers per Resident
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Chart audit at start of the trial to capture data on residents who died in the year prior to the trial. Chart audits also during the transition phase prior to Steps 2 and 3; and one month after the intervention period for the trial ends.
secondary_outcome.description: Chart data at each study site will be audited to capture data on the number of hospital transfers in the last year of life for residents who died 1 year before the trial or who die during the trial.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Hospital Deaths during the trial
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Chart audit at start of the trial to capture data on residents who died in the year prior to the trial. Chart audits also during the transition phase prior to Steps 2 and 3; and one month after the intervention period for the trial ends.
secondary_outcome.description: Chart data at each study site will be audited to capture data on the number of hospital deaths in the year prior to the trial and during the trial. Chart data at each study site will be audited to capture data on the number of hospital transfers in the residents last year of life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bereaved Family Satisfaction with End of Life Care
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks to 2 months after the resident's death
secondary_outcome.description: Qualitative interview with family members whose loved one died during the trial.

secondary_outcome.measure: Resident Perceptions of End of Life Care
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During each of the 3 transition periods prior to the intervention periods in each Step.
secondary_outcome.description: Focus groups with residents living in the long-term care home

secondary_outcome.measure: Staff Perceptions of and Experiences with End of Life Care
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During each of the 3 transition periods prior to the intervention periods in each Step; and one month after the intervention period in each step.

secondary_outcome.measure: Resident Satisfaction with End of Life Care
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrolment and 2 months after the Family Care Conference or 1 month after the intervention period if no Family Care Conference occurred.
secondary_outcome.description: Qualitative interview with residents who are enrolled in the trial

other_outcome.time_frame: Checklist completed weekly during the intervention period for up to 160 weeks.

intervention.intervention_name: Strengthening a Palliative Approach in Long-Term Care (SPA-LTC) Program
intervention.description: Our team will work with long-term care homes in the study to implement the Strengthening a Palliative Approach in Long Term Care (SPA-LTC) which consists of the following core, evidence-informed components: Interdisciplinary Champion Teams (to provide leadership and support implementation); Palliative Care Education (including illness trajectory pamphlets); Comfort Care Rounds with staff (for capacity building and reflection); Prognostic Tools to trigger end-of-life discussions; Palliative Care Conferences with families and residents; Bereavement Pamphlets; and Post-Bereavement Follow-Up for families, and staff.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- English-speaking LTC residents with a score of 50% or less on the Palliative Performance Scale.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Non-English speaking LTC residents
- residents with a score of more than 50% on the Palliative Performance Scale.
